fields.headline: Somewhere in Britain
fields.bodyText: Carnival time Top steel bands compete as Notting Hill Carnival weekend gets under way today. Eleven bands on flat bed trucks will roll past the judges in Kensal Road. Ladbroke Grove. Spectators should watch from Hornimans Pleasance Park, Kensal Road, (nearest tubes: Ladbroke Grove/ Westbourne Park). Tonight 6pm-midnight. Free. 020-8964 0544. You will go to the ball Rossini's La Cenerentola - Cinderella - will be sung in English at this year's Mid Wales Opera Festival. Sarah Jillian Cox will perform the title role. Theatre Hafren, Newtown, Powys. September 4, 6 and 7, 7.30pm (and then a tour of various locations in Britain).£12-£20. 01686 625007, www.midwalesopera.co.uk. Those magnificent men A Bristol Boxkite, a Miles Magister, a Hawker Tomtit and an Avro Triplane are among the vintage aircraft scheduled to fly this evening in Bedfordshire. Shuttleworth Collection, Old Warden aerodrome, near Biggleswade. Flying starts 5.30pm (weather permitting) tonight. £10 adults, accompanied children 15 and under free. 01767 627288, Shuttleworth. All that jazz Trombonist Roy Williams, reedman star Alan Barnes and 17-year-old pianist Jack "Kid" Carter, as well as Georgie Fame, are among those on the bill at the Bude Jazz Festival, which opens today. Various venues in Bude, Cornwall. Until August 31.For ticket prices 01288 356360, Blues Jazz Festival. North-eastern eye Food stalls, live Punjabi, Pakistani, Bengali and Hindi music, arts, crafts, fashion shows and diversions for kids at the Newcastle Mela, a two-day Asian festival. Exhibition Park, Newcastle Upon Tyne. Tomorrow and Monday, noon-7pm (7.30pm Mon). Free. www.newcastlemela.co.uk. Local environmentalists Workshops, displays and exhibitions at this "green road show" taking place in Kent, on topics such as alternative transport, renewable energy, using local produce and recycling. Rare Breeds Trust, Highlands Farm,Woodchurch, Near Ashford. Tomorrow and Monday, 10.30am-5.30pm. £4 adults, £3 seniors/disabled adults, £2.50 children (3-15 inclusive), under 3s free. 01233 861493, Rare Breeds Trust. Full steam ahead Steam powers tractors, haulage vehicles and roundabouts in Dorset next week. More than 200 working engines accom-panied by over 100 fairground organs. Tarrant Hinton, near Blandford Forum. August 28-September 1, 9am-12pm (closes 6pm Sunday). £11 adults, £8.50 seniors, £5 children 6-16, under 6 free, £27 families (2 adults/2 children). See www.steam-fair.co.uk for discounts. Paddle power Coracles have been used for centuries in Wales and the borders. Try handling one on the River Severn as aficionado paddlers from all over Britain race their craft and even play polo in them. Green Wood Trust Coracle Regatta, Ironbridge, near Telford. Monday, noon-4pm. £1 adults. Green Wood Trust.
